channel.title: Comments on: Where are the Data Sources and Data Source Views in SSIS 2012?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.dc:creator: Axel Achten (axel8s)
item.description: You're right I put it into a new post: <a href="/index.php/DataMgmt/ssis-1/here-are-my-ssis-2012">new blog</a><br />
item.content:encoded: You’re right I put it into a new post: new blog

item.title: By: Carla Sabotta
item.dc:creator: Carla Sabotta
item.description: If you use the legacy package deployment model, data sources can be added to the project. When you convert an SSIS 2012 to the legacy package deployment model, the Data Sources folder re-appears in Solution Explorer.
item.content:encoded: If you use the legacy package deployment model, data sources can be added to the project. When you convert an SSIS 2012 to the legacy package deployment model, the Data Sources folder re-appears in Solution Explorer.
